intro: Chaetogastra latifolia, commonly known as the broadleaf chaetogastra, is a flowering plant native to specific regions in Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in grasslands and open woodlands, preferring well-drained soils. Its leaves are broad and lance-shaped, often with a hairy texture, while its flowers are small and yellow, arranged in clusters. It plays a role in local ecosystems by providing nectar for pollinators and habitat for small invertebrates.
